data.title: Temple University
data.meta_description: Temple University is excited to announce the appointment of Jeff Brandes as the new Director of Tennis. Brandes, who has been serving as the head coach for b...
data.text:
Temple University is excited to announce the appointment of Jeff Brandes as the new Director of Tennis. Brandes, who has been serving as the head coach for both men's and women's tennis teams at Fairleigh Dickinson University, brings a wealth of experience and a proven track record of success to the Owls' tennis program.

Jeff Brandes has been recognized for his exceptional coaching abilities, including being named the Landmark Conference Coach of the Year in 2010 and 2011, and the Intercollegiate Tennis Association Northeast Coach of the Year in 2011. His career highlights include leading the men's program at Drew University to seven MAC/Freedom Conference Championships, six Landmark Conference Titles, and five NCAA Tournament appearances. One of his men's doubles teams won the Northeast ITA regional, qualified for the Small College Nationals, and attained a rank of #7 nationally to earn All-American status.

"We are excited to have Coach Brandes join our team to lead and develop our tennis student-athletes," said Arthur Johnson, Vice President and Debbie and Stanley Lefkowitz '65 Director of Athletics at Temple University. "His passion for tennis and his commitment to excellence on and off the court have been evident over his impressive coaching career. I want to thank our student-athletes through this process and the committee for bringing us great candidates to consider."

In his new role at Temple University, Brandes will oversee both the men's and women's tennis teams, bringing his coaching techniques and strategic vision to the forefront. His appointment reiterates our commitment to fostering a competitive and dynamic environment for student-athletes.

"I am honored and thrilled to accept the position of Director of Tennis at Temple University," said Jeff Brandes. "This is an incredible opportunity to lead and grow a program with a rich history and promising future. I look forward to working with the talented athletes, dedicated staff, and passionate community to achieve new heights both on and off the court. I am very thankful to Vice President and Debbie and Stanley Lefkowitz '65 Director of Athletics Arthur Johnson, as well as to Co-Search Committee Chairs Prince Moody and Kristy Bannon, along with the entire search committee for placing their trust in me for this important role."

About Temple University Athletics Temple University Athletics is committed to providing a holistic experience for its student-athletes through competitive sports programs, academic excellence, and community engagement. For more information, visit Temple University Athletics website.
